comments.author: SeeminglyScience
comments.body: It also does the work of checking mutability for you.  If the struct is mutable, it performs the copy, boxes the result, and returns that. If the struct is not mutable (or is a ref type) it returns the boxed instance you passed it.

title: Use `RuntimeHelpers.GetObjectValue` to copy boxed valuetypes
